titleStmt.title: C. H. Smith v. William Cochrane. Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus

bibl.title: C. H. Smith v. William Cochrane. Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: Wherefor your petitioner prays that a Writ of Habeas Corpus maybe granted direct tomthe said William Cochrane sheriff as aforesaid commanding him to have the body of the said I. J. Smith beforee your honor at a time and place therein to be specified to do and receive which shall then and there be considered by your honor concerning the said I. H. Smith together with the time and cause of hid detention and the said writ; and that he the said Smith be restored to his liberty. Osborn & Dyer Attys for Petitioner

Territory of Washington, County of King ss I. J. C. H. Smith being duly sworn on oath states that he is the petitioner in the foregoing petition that he has heard the same read knows the contentd theref and beleives the same to be true. C H Smith
Subscribed and sworn to before me Feb 8th 1889 Richard Osborn Notary Public
